Description: Rim and body sherd of Chian black figured Sphinx and Lion Style pottery stemmed bowl with everted square rim; white slip; interior reserved; top of rim reserved; exterior: short diagonal strokes at rim above narrow band; below, black-figure decoration consisting of lion (head and part of neck remaining), to right; at right, part of tail of second lion to right.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Lemos places this sherd in Group E of the Sphinx and Lion Style. The vases in this group are the latest in the series of the Sphinx and Lion Style and the execution of the imagery is done in a hurried manner with no attention to detail. The figures are sketchy and in some cases, difficult to identify.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 148, p. 311, no. 1295, pl. 167)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.2126) (phase 2)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
